column1: NGR is on the Golden Grove estate at about the correct altitude and is near a lake. The house is 150m SSW and 150 ft. higher. The 1870s and 1880s records do not have an altitude on them and may be in a different location on the estate.
There is also a reading of 39.12 inches for Feb to Dec 1873

On the 1880s record sheet the inspector has made the following comment "1884 almost identical with Dynevor Castle one of the returns believed to be fabricated. Viscount Emlyn written to but no satisfactory answer received". The 1884 readings are remarkably close, one identical, 6 within 0.01, 3 within 0.02 and 3 within 0.03 whereas the other years have a much bigger difference. Readings removed.
March 1924 reading is noted as being corrected for snow and has been left in this record
